meanings.definition: To count fewer instances of something than actually exist.
meanings.sent1: Sometimes, people undercount the number of cookies in the jar.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to undercount the number of students in the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved undercounting the number of cards in the deck.
meanings.sent4: The detective realized the suspect was trying to undercount their alibi.
meanings.sent5: She always tends to undercount the amount of time it takes to finish a task.

meanings.definition: An instance of counting fewer instances of something than actually exist.
meanings.sent1: The undercount of apples in the basket led to confusion.
meanings.sent2: The undercount of votes in the election raised concerns about accuracy.
meanings.sent3: The undercount of candies in the jar made the game more challenging.
meanings.sent4: The undercount of books in the library was discovered during inventory.
meanings.sent5: The undercount of coins in the piggy bank was a surprise to the child.
